p: Air quality is impacted by pollution associated with combustion processes that includes smog, soot, acid rain, and toxic air emissions [27]. There are about 6.5 million deaths each year due to air pollution according to the World Health Organization (WHO) [4]. Poor urban air quality associated with coal burning power plants and transportation has caused health problems for many people and some deaths. Reductions in carbon emissions are generally beneficial to air quality and health. Climate change is expected to impact asthma and allergies by extending the growing seasons of vegetation that emit pollen [28]. Global warming will also lead to more wildfires and dust storms which emit particulates that impact air quality and health [3].
